chargeHist.descr: Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Raighee Tylee Day

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris in court for Raighee Tylee Day.  Prosecuting attorney Samuel E. Simpson in court for the State of Wisconsin. State informed defense that new charges have been filed for this defendant. Attorney Harris asks that Court holds the motion to withdraw in abeyance.Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court. Court appoints Attorney Harris on defendants new case, 22CF3961, which needs an initial appearance.

***
Recalled at 9:45 AM. Defendant Raighee Tylee Day in court, in custody.  Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris in court for Raighee Tylee Day.  Prosecuting attorney Samuel E. Simpson in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court grants motion to withdraw and vacates previously ordered appointment on case 22CF3961. SPD to appoint on both cases. Case is adjourned in Branch 36.
Status conference scheduled for November 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.
records.descr: Motion and order for withdrawal of counsel

records.addlTxt: Motion to withdraw received and filed; forwarded to the Judge for review.

Defendant Raighee Tylee Day appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris in court for Raighee Tylee Day.  Attorney Michael R Staskunas in court for State of Wisconsin. Status conference held. Attorney Harris was recently appointed, has received discovery and an offer. Attorney Harris is requesting additional time to review materials with his client and is requesting a plea and sentencing date. Case is adjourned in Branch 36.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris in court, defendant Raighee Tylee Day not in court, in custody.  Jessica Bellows appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a bail/bond hearing.  Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.  Defense requests a status conference.  Court scheduled the matter as requested.  Case adjourned to Branch 36.  Status conference scheduled for August 30, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.

Defendant Raighee Tylee Day in court with Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris; both appear by video.  Defendant Raighee Tylee Day in custody.  Edward OBrien appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 38, Judge Wagner. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Defense to be heard on bail on the next date. Case is adjourned to Br. 38.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for July 26, 2022 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Raighee Tylee Day in court, in custody.  Samuel E. Simpson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy Court Clerk: STW
Case set for Hearing. Attorney Thomas Reed, Public Defender's Office. Report tendered to the court regarding appointment. Court will appoint Attorney Thomas E. Harris at the county rate of $100.00 an hour and held repayment in abeyance. Court set matter for preliminary hearing, Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.
SPD Appointment of Counsel Report; filed.

Defendant Raighee Tylee Day not in court, defendant in custody.  Stephanie Krueger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a State V. Lee hearing in the trial court.  Hearing scheduled for June 30, 2022 at 08:15 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Level 5 Supervision with Electronic Monitoring; no contact order.  If electronic monitoring device is unavailable and cash bail has been paid, Defendant to be released and placed on the waiting list.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Court ordered no contact with J.N.J.; E.M.R.; S.D.N.
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Defendant Raighee Tylee Day in court with attorney Michael J Cerniglia.  Defendant Raighee Tylee Day in custody.  Daniel T Flaherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Raighee Tylee Day appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  Defense enters a plea of NOT GUILTY as to misdemeanor counts 2, 3 and 5.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defense request to be heard on bail at preliminary hearing.
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.
